Description: Fragment of bowl of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior: reserved band below junction of bowl and lip; below, glazed black; exterior: lip glazed with thin reserved line at join with bowl; below, black-figure decoration consisting of horseback riders (only head including mane and reins, neck and breast with added red, shoulder and upper forelegs of one horse and tail of second remaining), to right; at far right, possibly incised pinwheel rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

There are strong similarities between the horse on this sherd and a horse on an Attic Siana cup from Naukratis, see Oxford AN1953.628. The sherd was first published in CVA Reading (5, pl. 11) as a Corinthian kylix.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 5, pl. II, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0667) (Phase 1)
